<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/4e2114e988f5d8635f2ad748be3cafcc44289138|patch 8.2.1809: mapping some keys with Ctrl does not work properly>
patch 8.2.1809: mapping some keys with Ctrl does not work properly

Problem:    Mapping some keys with Ctrl does not work properly.
Solution:   For terminal, GTK and Motif handle "@", "^" and "_" codes.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1809: mapping some keys with Ctrl does not work properly · vim/vim@4e2114e
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1809: mapping some keys with Ctrl does not work properly · vim/vim@4e2114e
attachments.text: Problem: Mapping some keys with Ctrl does not work properly. Solution: For terminal, GTK and Motif handle "@", "^" and "_" codes.

patch 8.2.1807: can use :help in a terminal popup window

Problem:    Can use :help in a terminal popup window.
Solution:   Give an error. (closes #7088)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/253b16a4abdad1df350b9ddd9a709520b063934c|patch 8.2.1806: MS-Windows with Python: Vim freezes after import command>
patch 8.2.1806: MS-Windows with Python: Vim freezes after import command

Problem:    MS-Windows with Python: Vim freezes after import command.
Solution:   Use either "NUL" or "CONIN$" when reopening stdin. (Yasuhiro
            Matsumoto, closes #7083)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1806: MS-Windows with Python: Vim freezes after import command · vim/vim@253b16a
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1806: MS-Windows with Python: Vim freezes after import command · vim/vim@253b16a
attachments.text: Problem: MS-Windows with Python: Vim freezes after import command. Solution: Use either "NUL" or "CONIN$" when reopening stdin. (Yasuhiro Matsumoto, closes #7083)
